alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 3:39PM PDT until April 20 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Nevada, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 330 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM PDT, emergency management reported snowmelt flooding over SR 140. This is causing small stream flooding. - SR 140 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern Humboldt County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
